passage_text: Scots Word of the Season: Sassenach. Sassenach adj. and n. English; an English person. Sassenach is derived from the Scottish Gaelic word sasunnach, literally meaning 'Saxon', and originally used by Gaelic speakers to refer to non-Gaelic speaking Scottish Lowlanders. The divisive aspect of sassenach is mitigated somewhat by its adoption by English people.
